0: Baggies of marijuana accidentally donated. (Photo: Maplewood Police Department) NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR MAPLEWOOD - Isn’t it habit to check your pants pockets before washing, donating or anything with them? NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR It should be second nature, but for one person, that mistake cost them 111 grams of marijuana. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR According to the Maplewood Minnesota Police Department Facebook page, a person or persons donated clothing to a local store. In that clothing was over 100 grams of marijuana. The Twitter post says the clothes were donated to Once Upon A Child, a store that sells gently used children’s clothing. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The Facebook post jokingly asked the owner to come forward so they could be “reunited” with their lost property. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR #VRA Hey genius, Once Upon A Child thanks you for the clothing donation, but you forgot something in your pant pockets... sucks to be you... pic.twitter.com/KM4LbB1SM0 — Maplewood Police MN (@MaplewoodPolice) May 20, 2017 NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR No word on whether that person actually did come forward.
